## Conversion.GenericDefaultingConverter.optional() method

Creates a [Converter](./ts-utils.converter.md) for an optional value.

**Signature:**

```typescript
optional(onError?: ('failOnError' | 'ignoreErrors') | undefined): Converter<T | TD | undefined, TC>;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  onError | ('failOnError' \| 'ignoreErrors') \| undefined | _(Optional)_ Specifies handling of values that cannot be converted (default <code>ignoreErrors</code>). |

**Returns:**

[Converter](./ts-utils.converter.md)<!-- -->&lt;T \| TD \| undefined, TC&gt;

A new [Converter](./ts-utils.converter.md) returning `<T|undefined>`<!-- -->.

## Remarks

If `onError` is `failOnError`<!-- -->, the resulting converter will accept `undefined` or a convertible value, but report an error if it encounters a value that cannot be converted.

If `onError` is `ignoreErrors` (default) then values that cannot be converted will result in a successful return of `undefined`<!-- -->.
